article.title: Northrop Grumman Wins Navy Command And Control Software Development And Integration Award
article.author: Henry Kenyon
article.text: Northrop Grumman Corporation has received a U.S. Navy contract to provide command and control (C2) software development and modification and enhancement of existing C2 and tactical data link systems. Northrop Grumman is one of five firms receiving awards under an indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity (ID/IQ) contract from the Space and Naval Warfare System Command, San Diego. Under the agreement, which has a potential value of more than $600 million, the companies will provide software design, development and modification; software integration and related test evaluation; software systems engineering support; and support functions such as integrated logistics and configuration and program management.
